body:
@ cyberpunk2077 fans

Yall need to fucking chill. Its a game. No big deal. Find something else to hyperfixate on. Stop trying to get them to overwork their devs and put out an unfinished game.

summary: if they dont announce the release date of cyberpunk 2077 at e3 i swear im going to lose it

trail.content: if they dont announce the release date of cyberpunk 2077 at e3 i swear im going to lose it

body:
E3 is next week…

So I decided to create a list of the games (in no particular order) that I’m most excited about and a few brief thoughts.

Fire Emblem Three Houses

Admittedly, I’m a casual Fire Emblem fan. I play the one that look most interesting me. (I skipped Fates and Echoes entirely, but did play Warriors.) But I do enjoy tactical role playing games and Three Houses looks absolutely fantastic. I’ve already preorder the Seasons of Warfare Edition.

Pokémon Sword and Shield

What can I say? You make another Main title Entry, I buy. I love Pokémon. It’s simple, it’s nostalgic and it’s always fun to experience a new region. Some hate that the new Pokémon are increasingly lacking in originality(Poor Trubish) but I keep playing Pokémon until I can’t anymore. I’m hoping for the game to have a bit more content and take advantage of the Switch.

Animal Crossing

We haven’t seen much of this title yet. Here’s hoping Nintendo drops a trailer. Like Pokémon, I play Animal Crossing for the casual fun and relaxing atmosphere it brings.

Code Vein

It’s dark, it’s got vampires and I love the God Eater series. In some circles it’s called Anime Souls. I played Souls and to some extent Bloodborne and if you’re looking for a game that will humble you I recommend either of those two titles. That said I can tell I’m going to enjoy Code Vein more. That’s only because I crave story and character driven plot. I was also really disappointed when it got delayed but here we are.

Cyberpunk 2077

I get ill after long period of playing in first person. Yup, I suffer from video game motion sickness. To that end I’ve been dedicating long play sessions of Fallout 4 in first person to be able to conquer my weakness. It has been getting thankfully easier. Room temperature (cooler) and lighting (darker) helps. I’ll admit I never had any interest in the Witcher series, (I’m sorry!) but I’ve been completely charmed by Cyberpunk. It looks gritty and raw. Most importantly it puts the players in control of their own story. Decisions, decisions, decisions and they matter. Also, I want to explore that city so badly.

Astral Chain

It just looks good. I really want to see game play and some story, but it looks really good to me.

The Outer Worlds

Welcome back Obsidian. This game came in on the disaster of Fallout 76. But Obsidian is coming in strong. This title looks fun and brighter than Fallout with an obvious hint at a sinister plot underneath.

Honorable mentions, some may happen, others will definitely not.

Fallout 3 Remake. (This one seems impossible)

Dragon Age 4 (At least a teaser of some sort or a little more information)

Rune Factory 5 (With everything else going on for Nintendo, I thought they might save this for an upcoming Direct.)

Nioh 2 (Give me more information!)

Enjoy E3 2019!!!

summary: Like Tears in The rain - Cyberpunk Playlist Tears in the Rain - Vangelis Utai IV: Reawakening - Steve Aoki Remix/Kenji Kawai...
caption:
Like Tears in The rain - Cyberpunk Playlist

  1. Tears in the Rain - Vangelis
  2. Utai IV: Reawakening - Steve Aoki Remix/Kenji Kawai
  3. Spoiler - Hyper
  4. 2049 - Hans Zimmer/Benjamin Wallfisch
  5. Future Club - Perturbator
  6. Disc wars - Daft Punk
  7. Blade Runner - Hans Zimmer/Benjamin Wallfisch
  8. Industrial Sector 3083 - Bourgeoisie
  9. Nightcall - Kavinsky
  10. Main Titles - Vangelis
  11. Tech Noir - Gunship
  12. The Dark Side - Muse
  13. Arrival - Daft Punk
  14. End Titles - Vangelis
  15. Rainbow Six Siege MainTheme - Paul Haslinger
  16. Menu - Nervous-Testpilot
  17. The Celestial City - Paradox Interactive
  18. Recognizer - Daft Punk
  19. Our Last Hope - Le Matos
  20. The Scientists - Cris Velasco
  21. Blade Runner Blues - Vangelis
  22. Impossible Dream - Lovett
  23. Suicide Mission - Jack Wall
  24. A Million on My Soul - Alexiane
  25. A Dystopian  Utopia - Celldweller
  26. Orion - 2WEI
  27. Power Core - Power Glove
  28. Enjoy the Silence - Ki: Theory
  29. Erased - Erik Ekholm
  30. Tears in the Rain - Hans Zimmer/Benjamin Wallfisch

summary: Hi guys! I am happy to announce that I’ve created a RedBubble Account and will be selling products of my Fan Art of Female and...
body: Hi guys! I am happy to announce that I’ve created a RedBubble Account and will be selling products of my Fan Art of Female and Male V! I have iPhone cases, stickers and notepads! ❤️ If you have any suggestions of products you’d like to have don’t be afraid to let me know ❤️

trail.content_raw: Hi guys! I am happy to announce that I’ve created a RedBubble Account and will be selling products of my Fan Art of Female and Male V! I have iPhone cases, stickers and notepads! ❤️ If you have any suggestions of products you’d like to have don’t be afraid to let me know ❤️
trail.content: Hi guys! I am happy to announce that I’ve created a RedBubble Account and will be selling products of my Fan Art of Female and Male V! I have iPhone cases, stickers and notepads! ❤️ If you have any suggestions of products you’d like to have don’t be afraid to let me know ❤️

blog.description: Welcome to the official Tumblr account of Cyberpunk 2077 — an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Developed by CD PROJEKT RED. #Cyberpunk2077
